input_text:
Job Title: Sr Associate, Growth Partnerships

Location: Chicago, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
Description

Title: Senior Associate, Partnerships and Business Development

Location: Flexible (Remote or Chicago). If remote, will be expected to travel to Chicago at least quarterly with additional travel as needed.

Company Description

Oak Street Health believes everyone deserves great healthcare â the kind you'd want for your own family. We specialize in providing exceptional care for older adults on Medicare, often in underserved communities where there is little or no quality healthcare.

Oak Street Health is on a mission to rebuild healthcare as it should be with an innovative care model that centers on wellness-based, positive health outcomes for patients, not the volume of services provided. Our unwavering commitment to keeping patients healthy is highlighted by dedicated care teams that take time to get to know each individual, providing the personalized care they need to stay healthy and live life more fully.

We're an organization on the move! Our rapidly growing national network of primary care centers is staffed by a diverse team of outstanding care providers, service team members, technologists, community outreach experts, business professionals, and more. For more information, visit http://www.oakstreethealth.com.

Role Description

The Senior Associate, Partnerships and Business Development will report to the Director, Partnerships and Business Development and will sit within the organization of the Senior Vice President of Partnerships and Business Development and the Chief Innovation Officer. You will support problem-solving, own both analytics and operational workstreams, and assist in making recommendations to key leaders including the C-suite on top organizational priorities.

This role will serve as an ideal jumping off point for exceptional analytical and business talent to enter a proven, high-growth organization at the cutting edge of healthcare innovation. The Senior Associate, Partnerships and Business Development will have the opportunity to own and drive mission-critical projects, gain cross-functional experience and leadership skills, and learn the Oak Street clinical and business model.

The ideal candidate will have strong relationship-building skills, be self-directed, and enjoy working with a team in a fast-paced high growth environment, while bringing their experience, leadership, and innovative ideas. The role will be fluid, evolving based on organizational priorities and the professional development of the Senior Associate. In addition to analytical projects, there will be significant opportunities to own operations that directly impact our clinical care teams and patients. This person will also get the opportunity to represent Oak Street by working directly with many of our external partners across payer, provider, facilities, health systems, and others within the healthcare ecosystem.

Core Responsibilities

Conduct financial and operational analysis to inform and develop new programs, lines of business, and growth opportunitiesManage cross-functional relationships to drive the execution of select initiativesCreate executive and operational reporting packages, presentations, and memosDrive strategic and analytical review of new, innovative growth opportunitiesOwn an operational workstream, including working with our clinic teammates Lead market and competitive research projectsOther duties, as assigned 

What are we looking for?

We're Looking For Motivated, Experienced Professional With

Bachelor's degree required 2-5 years of analytical work experienceManagement consulting, PE, investment banking, or healthcare analytics/operations experience preferred but not requiredExcellent problem-solving, analytical skills, and impeccable business judgmentStrong interpersonal skills that support effectively managing across various stakeholders within an organizationMust be highly proficient with Microsoft ExcelExperience with financial & analytical tools (e.g., Alteryx, Tableau, R, SQL) a plus but not requiredStrong written communication skillsUS work authorizationSomeone who embodies being 'Oaky' 

What does being 'Oaky' look like?

Radiating positive energyAssuming good intentionsCreating an unmatched patient experienceDriving clinical excellenceTaking ownership and delivering resultsBeing scrappy

Why Oak Street?

Oak Street Health Offers Our Coworkers The Opportunity To Be At The Forefront Of a Revolution In Healthcare, As Well As

Collaborative and energetic cultureFast-paced and innovative environmentCompetitive benefits including paid vacation and sick time, generous 401K match with immediate vesting, and health benefits

Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply to oakstreethealth.com/careers.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
